subject: Fashion
title: The Environmental Cost of Dyes
description: A quick win: understand The Environmental Cost of Dyes.

hook.text: Textile dyeing is the second-largest polluter of water worldwide.

buildup.text: Dyeing one T-shirt uses about 16 liters of water laced with toxic chemicals.

discovery.text: Rivers near textile factories in Bangladesh run blue, red, or green depending on season.

twist.text: Brands selling 'sustainable' collections still rely on conventional toxic dyeing.

climax.text: New waterless dyeing tech exists but costs moreâ€”slowing industry adoption.

punchline.text: Fashion's most colorful problem is its dirtiest secret.
